name: Cloak and Dagger Online Quiz | Comics | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Tandy Bowen.

	Tandy Bowen was raised in Ohio before she ran away to New York City. She was given experimental drugs that turned her into the superpowered Dagger. She frequently dresses in white.

questions.text: Cloak has a special bond with the Darkness Dimension.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Cloak's cloak serves as a gateway to the Dark force Dimension, not the Darkness Dimension. People who end up in the Dark force Dimension often feel cold and may become catatonic if they stay too long.

questions.text: How did Cloak and Dagger obtain their powers?
questions.explanation:
Through experimental drugs.

	Given experimental drugs by Kingpin's men, Tandy Bowen can create dagger-shaped light shards that have a purifying effect and Tyrone Johnson can teleport himself and others, as well as having a link to the Darkforce Dimension.

questions.text: What distinguished Tyrone Johnson before he became Cloak?
options: He was confined to a wheelchair
questions.explanation:
He stuttered.

	Tyrone's stutter was so bad that it prevented him from saving his best friend's life. While he has the cloak on, this defect disappears. If he and the cloak are separated, Cloak loses all of his power and his stutter returns.

questions.text: Whom were Cloak and Dagger looking for when they encountered the Runaways?
questions.explanation:
Molly Hayes.

	The corrupt Lieutenant Flores of the L.A.P.D. told Cloak and Dagger that the Runaways had kidnapped Molly Hayes, and asked the duo if they could rescue her. After a short fight with the Runaways, Cloak and Dagger learned that they had been deceived.

questions.text: Cloak and Dagger made their first appearance in the comic of which Marvel superhero?
questions.explanation:
Spider-Man.

	Cloak and Dagger first appeared in issue #64 of "Peter Parker, the Spectacular Spider-Man". Frequent allies of Spider-Man, Cloak and Dagger have also worked with the Power Pack.

questions.text: Cloak and Dagger were against the Superhuman Registration Act.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Along with Captain America, Wolverine and the Runaways, Cloak and Dagger opposed the Superhuman Registration Act, supported by Iron Man and other heroes. This controversial bill called for all heroes to reveal their identities and register themselves as living weapons of mass destruction.

questions.text: Which demon tried to feed on Cloak and Dagger's mutual despair soon after they obtained their powers?
questions.explanation:
D'Spayre.

	D'Spayre is a demon who feeds on the despair of living beings. He has fought Cyclops and many other superheroes over his tenure as an otherworldly villain in the Marvel Comics universe.

questions.text: How did Cloak and Dagger meet?
options: They lived in the same orphanage
questions.explanation:
Cloak returned  Dagger's purse.

	Tyrone Johnson was thinking about stealing Tandy Bowen's purse, but some other lowlife stole it before he did! Tyrone subdued the thief and returned Tandy's purse. The pair have been nearly inseparable ever since.

	Cloak is intangible or tangible at will. Nobody can harm or touch him while he is intangible, much like the Vision of the Avengers and Kitty Pryde of the X-Men.
